concept.title: Sametime iOS app configuration reference
concept.shortdesc: Refer to the following tables as you create a custom app configuration XML file.

conbody.p: You can use this table if your Enterprise mobility management (EMM) provider does not support the AppConfig schema as the AppConfig Community defines it.
If your EMM supports an AppConfig.xml file, then use the HCL_Sametime_AppConfig.xml file the MDM Configuration XML file for HCL Sametime for iOS support article provides.

p.note: All keys and values in the following table are case sensitive. If you manually copy these settings to your EMM file, ensure that the case you use matches this document. At a minimum, you must provide a value for the communityHostServer parameter. All other settings have default values that suffice for most installations, assuming that your Sametime server is internet facing and listening on port 443.

row.entry: Provide a nickname for the community. HCL provides a default value of AppConfig but you can enter your own value. If you leave this value blank, the apps uses the community host server name.

entry.p: Provide the fully qualified Sametime Proxy server host name or IP address.

p.note: If you are connecting through an authenticating proxy use that address here. If you leave this value blank, the app configuration is incomplete.

row.entry: Provide the port on which your Sametime Proxy server or Authenticating Proxy is listening.
For best results, leave this value as true, so the connection is over SSL. When the value is false, SSL is not used and this status might compromise the security of your data.
For best results, leave this value as false. When the value is true, the server can't identity of the community. This parameter only applies when Secure Connection value is set as true.

Specify whether this community configuration connects directly to the Sametime Proxy or uses an Authenticating Proxy such as HCL SafeLinx. If you choose Direct Connection, then the Host Server and Port configured earlier must be the address of the Sametime Proxy and it must be internet accessible. If you choose Authenticating Proxy, then the Host Server and Port must be the address of the authentication proxy.

This parameter applies only if the Connection Type is Authenticating Proxy. You can use macros if they are available. Consult your EMM documentation for the availability of substitution macros or variable names.

This parameter applies only if the Connection Type is Authenticating Proxy. You can use macros if they are available. Consult your EMM documentation for the availability of substitution macros or variable names.

This parameter applies only if the Connection Type in Advanced Properties is set to Authenticating Proxy. Set this option to true users enter the same credentials for the Authenticating Proxy and the Sametime Community.

Specify a password to be used with Sametime. This parameter is ignored if Share Auth Proxy Credentials is true. In this case the authenticating proxy ID and password is used to log into Sametime. Macros are accepted if they are available. Consult your EMM documentation for the availability of substitution macros or variable names.
Leave true to allow the password to be saved once entered. Set to false to force the user to enter a password with each login to HCL Sametime.
When true, the user is not able to edit this community configuration except for the password.
When true, the user is allowed to configure additional communities. When false, all community configurations except this one is removed.
Set to true to enforce that copy and paste operations are restricted to only this application. Chat information copied to the clipboard from inside Sametime app can only be pasted within Sametime.
